titleStmt.title: It is declared by the Lords and Commons in Parliament, that the stopping of the passages between Hull and the Parliament, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: by Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most Excellent Majestie: and by the assignes of John Bill,

notesStmt.note: Title from the opening lines of text.

"The intercepting of messengers or letters to and from Parliament is a high breach of the privileges of Parliament. All Lords, Lieutenants, sheriffs, &c., are to give their uttermost aid to the free passages of such messages, and to apprehend all those who would hinder in on any pretext. -- Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

person.persName: the Kings most Excellent Majestie: and
